meanings.definition: A person or thing that limits.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher was a limiter of fun in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The speed bumps on the road act as limiters to control traffic speed.
meanings.sent3: The limiter, also known as the 'fun police', made sure everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was a limiter holding her back from pursuing her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The limiter at the buffet table prevented guests from taking more than their fair share.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that limits the output of a system.
meanings.sent1: The voltage limiter protected the electronic devices from power surges.
meanings.sent2: The thermostat in the house acts as a limiter to maintain a comfortable temperature.
meanings.sent3: The limiter on the water faucet prevented the sink from overflowing.
meanings.sent4: The speed limiter on the car ensured the driver couldn't exceed a certain speed.
meanings.sent5: The noise limiter in the headphones kept the volume at a safe level to protect hearing.

meanings.definition: A tool used to set boundaries or restrictions.
meanings.sent1: The parent used screen time limiters to control their child's device usage.
meanings.sent2: The firewall acts as a limiter to prevent unauthorized access to the network.
meanings.sent3: The limiter on the cookie jar was no match for the determined cookie thief.
meanings.sent4: Her planner was a limiter for her schedule, ensuring she didn't overbook herself.
meanings.sent5: The calorie limiter app helped her track her daily intake and stay within her diet goals.
